item.title: Philosophy of Science
item.description:
• Time and Chance — David Albert (2000)
  • Philosophy of Physics: Space and Time — Tim Maudlin (2014)
  • Philosophy of Physics: Quantum Theory — Tim Maudlin (2019)
  • The Emergent Multiverse: Quantum Theory according to the Everett Interpretation — David Wallace (2014)
  • How the Laws of Physics Lie — Nancy Cartwright (1983)
  • Laws of Physics — Eddie Chen (2024)

Videos

  • Timothy Williamson: Is Philosophy a Science?

Queue

  • Studies in the Logic of Confirmation — Carl Gustav Hempel (1945).
  • Two Dogmas of Empiricism — Willard Van Orman Quine (1951).
  • Science: Conjectures and Refutations — Karl Popper (1962).

item.title: Beam and Plasma Physics Simulations
item.description:
• TEAPOT: A thin element accelerator program for optics and tracking
  • Noninvariance of Space- and Time-Scale Ranges under a Lorentz Transformation and the Implications for the Study of Relativistic Interactions
  • Symplectic multiparticle tracking model for self-consistent space-charge simulation
  • Symplectic particle-in-cell model for space-charge beam dynamics simulation
  • Symplectic machine learning model for fast simulation of space-charge effects
  • TOUTATIS: A radio frequency quadrupole code
  • Lie Methods for Nonlinear Dynamics with Applications to Accelerator Physics
  • Direct Vlasov solvers
  • Snowmass21 Accelerator Modeling Community White Paper
  • Quantum-inspired method for solving the Vlasov-Poisson equations
  • Differentiable self-consistent space-charge simulation for accelerator design
  • Two-and-a-half dimensional symplectic space-charge solver
  • Grid dependent noise and entropy growth in anisotropic 3d particle-in-cell simulation of high intensity beams

item.description: • Hamiltonian theory of the crossing of the 2Qx− 2Qy = 0 — Bazzani, Capoani, and M. Giovannozzi (2022)
